channel.title: Please help, i have windows 7 64 bit user, most sources are 32 bit
channel.description:
hello, i got a problem with my run.bat , i have windows 7 (64 bit) and most are 32 bit, my run.bat says java is not reconized as an internal or external command, i need a windows 7 run, i havn't seem to found any..
if you wish to help, please reply or add my msn recon_x@hotmail then email me, thanks =D

item.title: Please help, i have windows 7 64 bit user, most sources are 32 bit
item.dc:creator: @abatssk8ter abatssk8ter
item.description:

hello, i got a problem with my run.bat , i have windows 7 (64 bit) and most are 32 bit, my run.bat says java is not reconized as an internal or external command, i need a windows 7 run, i havn’t seem to found any…

if you wish to help, please reply or add my msn recon_x@hotmail then email me, thanks =D
[/quote]Post your run code.

Not necessary. Just set your paths, get an IDE, and build/run, or just make the 3 line batch.[/quote]He obviously cannot do that.

item.title: Please help, i have windows 7 64 bit user, most sources are 32 bit
item.dc:creator: @xforeverfree xforeverfree
item.description:
@xforeverfree wrote:

hello, i got a problem with my run.bat , i have windows 7 (64 bit) and most are 32 bit, my run.bat says java is not reconized as an internal or external command, i need a windows 7 run, i havn’t seem to found any…

if you wish to help, please reply or add my msn recon_x@hotmail then email me, thanks =D

I had the same problem :o .
Steps i did:
1.When i downloaded java jdk i made sure i downloaded jdk 64bit. ( i downloaded wrong one at first.)
2.go to “Start” then right click “computer” and select “propterties” then on the left hand side you should see “Advanced system settings” click that. When the new screen opens up click the “Environment Variables” button. In the botton scroll box thing ( :rolleyes: ) search for “Path” , Select it , then click “Edit” then copy the following code to the end of the “variable value” box
Code :
;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.22\bin;.
(remember to change the “22” to your upgrade)
Once you done that select all and copy the whole “variable value” box then click ok. Now in the second scroll box thingy again click new. In the “Variable name” call it “Classpath” and in the second box (Variable value) add the code you just copyed. Click ok untill everything you just opened goes away.

It Should work now
God i hope this helps cause it took a long ass time to type out. ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Please help, i have windows 7 64 bit user, most sources are 32 bit
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Covert it:
Edit where it says ‘Java’ and make it say ‘C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/java’
It should look exactly like this:

"C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/java"
